title: How to select world when using ./run_docker_compose.sh

content.raw:
If I modify the docker-compose.yml to change the world like this:

command: cloudsim\_sim.ign headless:=false worldName:=tunnel\_circuit\_practice\_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1

Then I don’t see any ROS messages \(such as IMU\) when I join the solution container.  If the worldName selection is not there then it is possible to join the solution and see the expected ROS messages.

What is the correct way to select the world when using ./run\_docker\_compose.sh?
content.html:
If I modify the docker-compose.yml to change the world like this:

command: cloudsim_sim.ign headless:=false worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

Then I don’t see any ROS messages (such as IMU) when I join the solution container. If the worldName selection is not there then it is possible to join the solution and see the expected ROS messages.

What is the correct way to select the world when using ./run_docker_compose.sh?
